thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Commercial Lending Fuels PNC Profits

author: Christina Rexrode
title: Commercial Lending Fuels PNC Profits
text:
PNC Financial Services Group Inc. said Friday that first-quarter earnings rose 16%, fueled by higher interest rates and commercial lending.
Profit at the Pittsburgh-based bank rose to $1.23 billion from $1.06 billion a year ago.
Per-share earnings for the recently ended quarter were $2.43, in line with expectations of analysts polled... RELATED VIDEO A Brief History of Retail Banking The retail banking industry is undergoing another major shift, and the future looks high-tech, sophisticated, and, for big banks, very urban. So what has changed? Photo: Shaumb√© Wright/The Wall Street Journal
